title: bst?
description: Write a function `bst?` that consumes any type of element and produces true if t is a binary search tree, and false otherwise. Duplicates are not allowed on either side of a sub-tree.

examples.explanation: An empty tree is a valid BST
A single node with no children is a valid BST
Tree with root 5, left child 2, right child 8 satisfies BST property
Left child 7 is greater than root 5, violating BST property

starterCode:
(define-struct node (left right key))

(define (bst? t))

(bst? empty)
(bst? (make-node empty empty 5))
(bst? (make-node (make-node empty empty 2) (make-node empty empty 8) 5))
(bst? (make-node (make-node empty empty 7) (make-node empty empty 8) 5))
hiddenCases: (check-expect (bst? (make-node (make-node (make-node empty empty 1) (make-node empty empty 3) 2) (make-node (make-node empty empty 6) (make-node empty empty 8) 7) 5)) true)
(check-expect (bst? (make-node (make-node (make-node empty empty 1) (make-node empty empty 6) 2) (make-node empty empty 8) 5)) false)
